summary: In Rex v Benedict Eyaboro Khama, the West African Court of Appeal reviewed convictions of four appellants charged with cheating under s 421, stealing under s 390, and possession of stolen goods under s 430 of the Criminal Code. The court found that the evidence supported a false pretence under s 418 and conviction under s 419, but not a fraudulent trick under s 421. It held that the trial judge erred in convicting under s 421 but could have, and should have, convicted under s 419 as an alternative to the stealing charge, which was wrongly dismissed for duplicity. Under s 11(2) of the West African Court of Appeal Ordinance, the court substituted the verdicts for the first and third accused to guilty under s 419 and sentenced them to 18 months and 2 years' imprisonment with hard labour, respectively. Their convictions under s 430 were quashed, as one cannot be separately convicted for possessing money obtained by the same fraudulent act. The appeals of the second and fourth accused against their s 430 convictions were dismissed due to sufficient supporting evidence. The appellants' request to adduce further evidence on appeal was denied.
legalKeywords: West African Court of Appeal Ordinance
verdict: Convictions under s 421 and s 430 for 1st and 3rd accused set aside; substituted with conviction under s 419. Convictions under s 430 quashed. Appeals of 2nd and 4th accused dismissed.
winningSide: Crown (partial; convictions upheld for 2nd and 4th accused, modified for 1st and 3rd)
citations: West African Court of Appeal Ordinance, s 11(2)
rationaleHighlights: Evidence showed false pretence under s 418, not fraudulent trick under s 421, warranting conviction under s 419.
Charge of stealing under s 390 should have been treated as alternative, not duplicitous.
Conviction under s 430 improper when principal offence of obtaining by false pretence already established.
Court exercised power under s 11(2) WA CA Ordinance to substitute verdict under s 419.
Convictions under s 430 for 1st and 3rd accused quashed; appeals of 2nd and 4th dismissed.
